Interface Instrument

All Known Implementing Classes:
InstrumentLite, MultiStringInstrument, VisualInstrument
public interface Instrument

The Instrument interface specifies a methods used to implement a musical instrument that can play various notes that correspond to characters such as associated with keys typed by the user or read from a file.

Method Summary
 boolean hasString(char string)
          Indicates if the parameter corresponds to a string in the instrument.
 void play()
          Plays the current sound (sum of all strings).
 void pluck(char string)
          Plucks the string associated with the parameter.
 void tic()
          Advances the simulation by invoking each string's tic method.
 

Method Detail

hasString

boolean hasString(char string)
Indicates if the parameter corresponds to a string in the instrument.

Parameters:
string - a character that may correspond to a string
Returns:
true if there is a string that corresponds to the parameter; false otherwise

play

void play()
Plays the current sound (sum of all strings).

pluck

void pluck(char string)
Plucks the string associated with the parameter.

Parameters:
string - a character corresponding to a string to be plucked

tic

void tic()
Advances the simulation by invoking each string's tic method.
